lines: Within the Pile, Dame Nature plies no trades.
Within the might Pile there are no groves or glades
Where zephyrs whisper sweetly. So the droves of blades,
The warlike troves of armour, ring along arcades
And staircases and halls. The ambuscades
Of swordplay find no peace till echo fades
With daylight's dying down the dull parades.
Then tortured spirits flee among the shades
Or linger ruined till the morrow's raids.
